member.name: T:DowJones.Session.ControlDataManager
member.summary: Summary description for ControlDataManager.

member.name: M:DowJones.Session.ControlDataManager.GetControlDataForTransactionCache(DowJones.Session.IControlData,System.String,DowJones.Caching.CacheScope,System.Int32,System.Int32,DowJones.Caching.CacheExiprationPolicy,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the control data for transaction cache.
member.param: CacheKey is a string with a maximum length of 64 characters. The valid characters are [A..Z],[a..z],[0..9] and the underscore character. Transactions with a CacheKey that do not meet this specification will return an error.

CacheScope indicates how a Cache Item is shared by different Sessions.If CacheScope is Session, the Cache Item is not shared and is only relevant for the Session in which it was created. If CacheScope is Account, the Cache Item is shared by all Sessions created by users in the same account. If CacheScope is All, the Cache Item is shared by all Sessions. If the CacheScope parameter is not supplied or the value of CacheScope is not one of the valid values described above, an error will be returned for this transaction.

CacheExpirationTime is a value expressed in minutes that indicates how long Session Server should save a Cache Item. Session Server will remove a Cache Item when the number of minutes specified by CacheExpirationTime has elapsed from either the Cache Item creation time or last access time (see optional CacheExpirationPolicy below). For Cache Items with a Cache Scope of Session, the Cache Item will be removed when the Session is terminated by either a user logout or a Session timeout even if the Cache Expiration Time has not been reached. If CacheExpirationTime is not supplied, an error will be returned for this transaction.

CacheRefreshInterval is a value expressed in minutes that indicates how often Session Server should perform backend transactions in order to refresh the contents of the Cache Item. The backend transaction performed will be the Request that was saved when the Cache Item was created. If CacheRefreshInterval is not supplied, an error will be returned for this transaction.

CacheExpirationPolicy determines how the CacheExpirationTime value will be construed. If CacheExpirationPolicy is Absolute, the Cache Item will be removed when the number of minutes specified by CacheExpirationTime has elapsed from the time the Cache Item was created. If CacheExpirationPolicy is Sliding, the Cache Item will be removed when the number of minutes specified by CacheExpirationTime has elapsed from the last time the Cache Item was accessed. The default value for CacheExpirationPolicy is Absolute. For Cache Items with CacheScope set to Session, the Cache Item will be removed when the Session is terminated by either a user logout or a Session timeout even if the CacheExpirationTime has not been reached. If the value of CacheExpirationPolicy is not one of the valid values described above, an error will be returned for this transaction.

ForceCacheRefresh is a Boolean parameter that if set to True, triggers Session Server to send this transaction to the backend and update the Cache Item associated with the supplied CacheKey and CacheScope. Session Server will replace the saved Request, CacheExpirationTime, CacheRefreshInterval and CacheExpirationPolicy with those supplied with this transaction.

member.name: M:DowJones.Session.ControlDataManager.GetControlDataForTransactionCache(DowJones.Session.IControlData,System.String,DowJones.Caching.CacheScope,System.Int32,System.Int32,DowJones.Caching.CacheExiprationPolicy,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the control data for transaction cache.
member.param: CacheKey is a string with a maximum length of 64 characters. The valid characters are [A..Z],[a..z],[0..9] and the underscore character. Transactions with a CacheKey that do not meet this specification will return an error.

CacheScope indicates how a Cache Item is shared by different Sessions.If CacheScope is Session, the Cache Item is not shared and is only relevant for the Session in which it was created. If CacheScope is Account, the Cache Item is shared by all Sessions created by users in the same account. If CacheScope is All, the Cache Item is shared by all Sessions. If the CacheScope parameter is not supplied or the value of CacheScope is not one of the valid values described above, an error will be returned for this transaction.

CacheExpirationTime is a value expressed in minutes that indicates how long Session Server should save a Cache Item. Session Server will remove a Cache Item when the number of minutes specified by CacheExpirationTime has elapsed from either the Cache Item creation time or last access time (see optional CacheExpirationPolicy below). For Cache Items with a Cache Scope of Session, the Cache Item will be removed when the Session is terminated by either a user logout or a Session timeout even if the Cache Expiration Time has not been reached. If CacheExpirationTime is not supplied, an error will be returned for this transaction.

CacheRefreshInterval is a value expressed in minutes that indicates how often Session Server should perform backend transactions in order to refresh the contents of the Cache Item. The backend transaction performed will be the Request that was saved when the Cache Item was created. If CacheRefreshInterval is not supplied, an error will be returned for this transaction.

CacheExpirationPolicy determines how the CacheExpirationTime value will be construed. If CacheExpirationPolicy is Absolute, the Cache Item will be removed when the number of minutes specified by CacheExpirationTime has elapsed from the time the Cache Item was created. If CacheExpirationPolicy is Sliding, the Cache Item will be removed when the number of minutes specified by CacheExpirationTime has elapsed from the last time the Cache Item was accessed. The default value for CacheExpirationPolicy is Absolute. For Cache Items with CacheScope set to Session, the Cache Item will be removed when the Session is terminated by either a user logout or a Session timeout even if the CacheExpirationTime has not been reached. If the value of CacheExpirationPolicy is not one of the valid values described above, an error will be returned for this transaction.

ForceCacheRefresh is a Boolean parameter that if set to True, triggers Session Server to send this transaction to the backend and update the Cache Item associated with the supplied CacheKey and CacheScope. Session Server will replace the saved Request, CacheExpirationTime, CacheRefreshInterval and CacheExpirationPolicy with those supplied with this transaction.

CacheWait is a enumeration parameter that if set to True, triggers Session Server to send this transaction to the backend and update the Cache Item associated with the supplied CacheKey and CacheScope. Session Server will replace the saved Request, CacheExpirationTime, CacheRefreshInterval and CacheExpirationPolicy with those supplied with this transaction.

member.name: M:DowJones.Managers.Core.StringUtilitiesManager.DetectCJK(System.String)
member.summary: Detects if the string contains Japanese specific kana or CJK kanji/han characters and returns the language detected - either 'ja', 'cjk', or null, if no CJK language detected. Note: given the set of languages currently supported by Factiva, a CJK character is assumed for any character with a codepoint over 0x3000. However, this is a coarse generalisation and may need to be refined as additional langauges are supported.
member.returns: the query language if cjk language detected, otherwise null

member.name: M:DowJones.Managers.Core.StringUtilitiesManager.HasCJK(System.String)
member.summary: Detects if the string contains Japanese specific kana or CJK kanji/han characters and returns the language detected - either 'ja', 'cjk', or null, if no CJK language detected. Note: given the set of languages currently supported by Factiva, a CJK character is assumed for any character with a codepoint over 0x3000. However, this is a coarse generalisation and may need to be refined as additional langauges are supported.
member.returns: true if the specified s has CJK characters; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:DowJones.Managers.Core.StringUtilitiesManager.CharacterEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes all characters with codepoints above the ascii code page with their unicode codepoint

members.member:
Encodes all characters with codepoints greater than the supplied limit with their unicode codepoint character encoding.
The string to encode. The limit the codepoint above which characters should be converted to their encoded form. The character encoded string. Encodes all characters with codepoints greater than the supplied limit with their unicode codepoint character encoding.

member.name: M:DowJones.Managers.Core.StringUtilitiesManager.XmlUnencode(System.String)
member.summary: Reverses any xml encodings in the string. (e.g. reverts '&' to '&')

member.name: M:DowJones.Managers.Core.StringUtilitiesManager.XmlAttributeEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Xml encodes the string to be carried as attribute content - i.e escapes &, <, > and " but leaves ', or the basis that the element content will be enclosed in "" and not ''. Takes care not to double encode &'s which are the start of xml encodings.
member.returns: the encoded string, suitable to be carried as attribute content

member.name: M:DowJones.Managers.Core.StringUtilitiesManager.XmlElementEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Xml encodes the string to be carried as element content - i.e escapes &, < and > but leaves " and ' as these are permissible element content. Takes care not to double encode &'s which are the start of xml encodings.
member.returns: The encoded string, suitable to be carried as element content.

member.summary: Determines whether [is start of XML encoding] [the specified s].

member.returns: true if [is start of XML encoding] [the specified s]; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns a buffer containing the string up to the position specified.

member.summary: Creates a TagCloudGenerationRules object with default settings.

member.name: P:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules.TagUrlFormatString
member.summary: The formatting applied to the value in the NavigateUrl property of each Tag object. If left null or empty, tags will not be links. Default is empty. All occurrences of "{0}" in this string gets replaced with the url encoded version of the Text property of this tag.

member.name: P:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules.Order
member.summary: Value used to determine tag sort order. Default is Alphabetical.

member.name: P:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules.MaxNumberOfTags
member.summary: Max number of tags in cloud. Provide null for unlimited. Default is null.

member.name: P:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules.RequiredTagWeight
member.summary: The required weight for a tag to be included in cloud. Default is 1.

member.name: P:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules.TagToolTipFormatString
member.summary: The formatting applied to the value in the TagCount property of each Tag object. If left null or empty, tags will not have tooltips. Default is empty. All occurrences of "{0}" in this string gets replaced with the weight of the tag.

member.name: P:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional html attributes to be applied for each tag.

summary.para: Provides static factory methods for generation of IEnumerable<Tag>.

member.name: M:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagGenerator.CreateTags``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules)
member.summary: Creates Tag objects from a provided list of string tags. The more times a tag occurs in the list, the larger weight it will get in the tag cloud.
member.typeparam: A generic type that supports the ITag interface.
member.param: A TagCloudGenerationRules object to decide how the cloud is generated.
member.returns: A list of Tag objects that can be used to create the tag cloud.

member.name: M:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagGenerator.CreateTags``1(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Double},DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules)
member.summary: Creates Tag objects from a provided dictionary of string tags along with integer values indicating the weight of each tag. This overload is suitable when you have a list of already weighted tags, i.e. from a database query result.
member.typeparam: A generic type that supports the ITag interface.
member.param: A dictionary that takes a string for the tag text (as the dictionary key) and an integer for the tag weight (as the dictionary value).
A TagCloudGenerationRules object to decide how the cloud is generated.
member.returns: A list of Tag objects that can be used to create the tag cloud.

member.name: M:DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagGenerator.CreateTags``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.String,System.Double}},DowJones.Ajax.TagCloud.TagCloudGenerationRules)
member.summary: Creates Tag objects from a provided list of string tags along with integer values indicating the weight of each tag. This overload is suitable when you have a list of already weighted tags, i.e. from a database query result.
member.typeparam: A generic type that supports the ITag interface.
member.param: A list of KeyValuePair objects that take a string for the tag text and an integer for the weight of the tag.
A TagCloudGenerationRules object to decide how the cloud is generated.
member.returns: A list of Tag objects that can be used to create the tag cloud.

member.name: M:DowJones.Extensions.BitmapExtensions.ScaleProportional(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Scales the bitmap to the passed target size by respecting the aspect.

example.code: var bitmap = new Bitmap("image.png"); var thumbnail = bitmap.ScaleProportional(100, 100);

member.remarks: Please keep in mind that the returned bitmaps size might not match the desired size due to original bitmaps aspect.

member.name: M:DowJones.Extensions.ClientScriptJsonExtensions.CleanAndDeserialize``1(System.Web.Script.Serialization.JavaScriptSerializer,System.String)
member.summary:
Pre-processes , if necessary, to extract the inner object from a "d:" wrapped MsAjax response and removing "__type" properties to allow deserialization with JavaScriptSerializer into an instance of .
Note: this method is not limited to MsAjax responses, it will capably deserialize any valid JSON.

member.summary:
Pre-processes , if necessary, to extract the inner object from a "d:" wrapped MsAjax response and removing "__type" properties to allow deserialization with JavaScriptSerializer into an instance of anonymous type .
Note: this method is not limited to MsAjax responses, it will capably deserialize any valid JSON.

member.name: T:DowJones.Formatters.Algorithms.Text.Bidi
member.summary: The main class that implements the BIDI algorithm.
member.remarks: Note that the BiDi algorithm does not cover reordering a visual string to logical form. Some times the very same algorithm will do the job, but in more complex situations it'll fail. The correct way is to always work in logical form in memory, and only run the BiDi algorithm to display the results on the screen.

example.code: string visual = NBidi.NBidi.LogicalToVisual(string logical)

member.name: M:DowJones.Formatters.Algorithms.Text.Bidi.LogicalToVisual(System.String)
member.summary: Implementation of the BIDI algorithm, as described in http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr9/tr9-17.html
member.returns: The visual representation of the string.

member.name: M:DowJones.Formatters.Algorithms.Text.Bidi.LogicalToVisual(System.String,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Implementation of the BIDI algorithm, as described in http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr9/tr9-17.html
member.param: Implies where the original characters are.
Implies how many characters each original character occupies.
member.returns: The visual representation of the string.
